intro: Crepis bauhiniana, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in a cluster. Crepis bauhiniana is often found in temperate climates and is known for its resilience to poor soil conditions.
